title: [PARTIALLY RETRACTED] Cortical Neuron Number Matches Intuitive Perceptions Of Moral Value Across Animals
summary:
Key ideas
- Animals' intelligence is correlated with their number of cortical neurons.
- A scale can be created to place animals and humans on the same ladder using this correlation.
- Different animal rights people have different ideas for calculating the moral value of animals.

Key learnings
- People's intuitive ideas about the moral value of animals corresponded with their cortical neuron count.
- The survey results on how many animals it takes to have the same moral worth as a human are pretty similar to the neuron count of animals needed to equal one human.

Key questions
- How can a more representative population be surveyed to validate the results?
- Do different species of animal have similar moral values?
- Are there more accurate ways of calculating animal intelligence to determine their moral worth?
